page.title: 12Farming continued
page.content:
Cainhoe Manor continued Henry VIII's hunting lodges but this could be attributed to the fertile imagination of some estate agents.
There is an old mill, now redundant, converted into a dwelling house owned by Mr Russell who is a master sadler. He makes and repairs saddles in a workshop on the premises and also runs a business selling riding equipment and horse and pony food. His wife helps run the shop with the help of one part-time lady assistant. Mr Russell also has one apprentice sadler(female).
